#Text=FREEDOM
#Text=For a moment there was silence , following Tom 's wild cry and the noise of the thunderclap .
#Text=Then , as other , though less loud reverberations of the storm continued to sound , the captives awoke to a realization of what had happened .
#Text=They had been partially stunned , and were almost as in a dream .
#Text=" Are --

#Text= We 've been struck by lightning ! " Tom repeated .

column1: #Text=" I do n't know whether we 're all right or not . "
#Text=" We seem to be falling ! " exclaimed Lieutenant Marbury .
#Text=" If the whole gas bag is n't ripped to pieces we 're lucky , " commented Jerry Mound .
#Text=Indeed , it was evident that the Mars was sinking rapidly .
#Text=To all there came the sensation of riding in an elevator in a skyscraper and being dropped a score of stories .
#Text=Then , as they stood there in the darkness , illuminated only by flashes from the lightning outside the window , waiting for an unknown fate , Tom Swift uttered a cry of delight .
#Text=" We 've stopped falling ! " he cried .
#Text=" The automatic gas machine is pumping .

#Text=Part of the gas bag was punctured , but the unbroken compartments hold !

_	_	_	_

#Text= If part of the gas leaked out I do n't see why it was n't all set on fire and exploded , " observed Captain Warner .

column1: #Text=" It 's a non-burnable gas , " Tom quickly explained .
#Text=" But come on .

#Text=There seems to be something going on that may be in our favor .

column1: #Text=" What does it all mean ? '
#Text=" The bolt that struck the ship has knocked out some of our enemies !
#Text=" We must act quickly , while they are demoralized !

#Text=Tie ' em up !  cried Tom , for they had no weapons with which to make an attack .

column1: #Text=" Are there any of the foreigners back there ? '
#Text=" We 've made them secure .

column1: #Text=" Well , you 're out , now , and I think we 'll have you stand guard over these men .
